    • Method Detail

      • patchAllDates

        public static void patchAllDates(java.nio.file.Path imagePath,
                                 java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime newDate,
                                 boolean xmpDump)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Manages the patching of all detectable date metadata within a WebP file.
        Parameters:
        imagePath - the path to the PNG file
        newDate - the replacement date and time
        xmpDump - indicates whether to dump XMP data into an XML-formatted file for debugging, if the data is present. If true, a file is created based on the image name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file is inaccessible or structured incorrectly

      • processExifSegment

        private static void processExifSegment(WebpHandler handler,
                                       ImageRandomAccessWriter writer,
                                       java.time.ZonedDateTime zdt)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Surgically patches date tags within the eXIf chunk by parsing the embedded TIFF structure. This method respects the TIFF segment's native byte order (Little vs Big Endian) while performing in-place overwrites.

        Special handling is applied to GPS date stamps to ensure they are recorded in UTC, as outlined in the GPS specification.

        Parameters:
        handler - the chunk handler containing parsed metadata segments
        writer - the writer used to perform the in-place modification
        zdt - the new date and time to be applied
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs whilst accessing the file or parsing the TIFF data

      • processXmpSegment

        private static void processXmpSegment(WebpHandler handler,
                                      ImageRandomAccessWriter writer,
                                      java.time.ZonedDateTime zdt,
                                      boolean xmpDump)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Scans XML content within WebP 'XMP ' chunks for date tags and performs binary overwrites.

        To prevent data corruption in multi-byte UTF-8 environments, this method maps string-based character indices to physical byte offsets. It enforces fixed-width patching by padding values with spaces, ensuring the underlying RIFF chunk size remains constant.

        Parameters:
        handler - the active chunk
        writer - the writer used to perform the in-place modification
        zdt - the target date and time to be applied
        xmpDump - if true, exports the raw XMP payload to a file for inspection purposes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs whilst accessing the file or overwriting data
